macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: White House to Host Crypto Summit on Stablecoin Legislation
items.summary: The White House will convene banks and cryptocurrency operators next Monday for a summit chaired by the Cryptocurrency Committee, focusing on the Clarity Act and whether crypto firms can offer returns on stablecoins amid banking concerns over deposit outflows.

items.title: Bitcoin and XRP Surge Ahead of Fed's 2026 Rate Decision
items.summary: Bitcoin rose 2.61% to $90,168 and XRP gained 2.74% to $1.93 ahead of the Federal Reserve's first 2026 policy meeting, where rates are expected to hold steady amid a resilient U.S. economy.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $88,000 with 1.41% Decline
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below 88,000 USDT to trade at 87,892 USDT, marking a 1.41% decrease over the past 24 hours according to market data.

items.title: a16z-Backed Address Purchases 243,000 HYPE Tokens
items.summary: An address backed by a16z bought 243,000 HYPE tokens via Anchorage, bringing its total holdings to 1.53 million tokens worth about $50.49 million.

items.title: US Marshals Investigate Possible Digital-Asset Hack
items.summary: The US Marshals Service is probing a potential cryptocurrency hack, following over $3.4 billion stolen in crypto hacks throughout 2025 per Chainalysis.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Infosys Unveils AI Innovations for Australian Open 2026
items.summary: Infosys launched Rally, an interactive AI mascot robot, and MatchFeel for visually impaired fans at the Australian Open 2026, powered by Infosys Topaz™ generative AI. Features include AI-powered insights like Keys to the Match and AI Shot of the Day for enhanced fan and player experiences.

items.title: Haber Wins Frost & Sullivan 2025 Award for Industrial AI Leadership
items.summary: Haber received Frost & Sullivan's 2025 Global Technology Innovation Leadership Recognition for advancing AI-driven process control in industrial settings, enabling adaptive self-optimizing systems for manufacturing efficiency and sustainability.

items.title: Stanford Hosts Event on Responsible AI Assessment in Education
items.summary: Stanford Accelerator for Learning and ETS convened leaders on January 29, 2026, to discuss socially responsible AI assessment practices across K-12, higher education, workforce, and research for equity and innovation.

items.title: AI Interactive Display Market Projected to Reach $15.81B by 2030
items.summary: The AI interactive display market is expected to grow from $9.22 billion in 2026 to $15.81 billion by 2030 at a 14.4% CAGR, driven by smart classrooms, digital collaboration, and AI-powered personalization in education, retail, and healthcare.

items.title: LEGO Education Spotlights AI Literacy at Bett 2026
items.summary: At Bett 2026, LEGO Education showcased AI literacy through keynotes, classroom sessions, and workshops, emphasizing hands-on learning and understanding AI models for young children with key guardrails.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Blizzard Entertainment Announces 35th Livestream Schedule with Major Game Updates
items.summary: Blizzard Entertainment has revealed a two-week celebration event from January 29th to February 11th featuring livestreams for World of Warcraft, Diablo 4, Overwatch, and Hearthstone. Producer Holly Longdale and game director Ion Hazzikostas will stream on January 29th at 9 AM Pacific Time to reveal new details about upcoming content.

items.title: World of Warcraft Midnight Expansion Confirmed for March 2, 2026 Release
items.summary: Blizzard has officially announced that WoW Midnight will launch on March 2, 2026, with Hardcore Mode returning in a new form. The Midnight Pre-Expansion is already available for early access.

items.title: Overwatch Spotlight Livestream Scheduled for February 4th
items.summary: Blizzard will host an Overwatch Channel for Spotlight on February 4th at 10 AM, where developers will highlight past achievements and discuss the future direction of the mature and stable game.

items.title: Red Bull LEGENDUS Street Fighter 6 Tournament Concludes with Final Day
items.summary: The LEGENDUS esports tournament hosted by legendary streamer SHAKA concluded its final tournament day on January 29th at Korakuen Hall, featuring top Street Fighter 6 players competing in team-based matches. The event is being sponsored by Nash and streamed on the official LEGENDUS YouTube channel.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield Launches with Ongoing Events and Banners
items.summary: Arknights: Endfield has launched with multiple gacha banners scheduled through March, including 'Scars of the Forge' (January 21-February 7) and 'The Floaty Messenger' (February 7-24). The game features a Voyage to the Stars event running until March 4th.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Copsys Technologies Selected for NATO DIANA Accelerator with $450K Provincial Investment
items.summary: Copsys Technologies has been selected for the NATO DIANA Accelerator program for its Digital Skin technology, which detects corrosion and structural stress in marine and offshore applications. The Government of Newfoundland and Labrador announced a $450,000 investment to support commercialization of the technology.

items.title: Kraken Robotics Secures $35M in Orders for SeaPower Pressure Tolerant Batteries
items.summary: Kraken Robotics announced recent orders totaling $35 million for their SeaPower pressure tolerant batteries, marking significant commercial traction in the marine technology sector.

items.title: Genoa Design International Acquired by Membertou First Nation and Horizon Naval Engineering
items.summary: Oceans Advance member Genoa Design International has been successfully acquired by Membertou First Nation and Horizon Naval Engineering, strengthening indigenous participation in the marine technology sector.

items.title: Microchip Expands maXTouch M1 Touchscreen Controller Series
items.summary: Microchip has expanded its maXTouch M1 touchscreen controller series to provide broader display size coverage, enhancing its product portfolio for diverse applications.

items.title: Virtualware and Mimbus Launch VIROO XR Platform in France
items.summary: Virtualware and Mimbus have partnered to launch the enterprise XR platform VIROO in France's education market, expanding extended reality solutions for educational institutions.
